intro: Megalocalyx propinqua, commonly known as the small-flowered meadow beauty, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, sunny to partially shaded habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its botanical features make it an attractive and ecologically valuable addition to native plant gardens.
